metadata.title: CVE-2020-12695 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Open Connectivity Foundation UPnP specification before 2020-04-17 doesnot forbid the acceptance of a subscription request with a delivery URL ona different network segment than the fully qualified event-subscriptionURL, aka the CallStranger issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.4-0ubuntu6.7
wpagui - 2.4-0ubuntu6.7
wpasupplicant - 2.4-0ubuntu6.7
No subscription required

minidlna - 1.1.5+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu6.7').
wpa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu6.7').
gupnp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
minidlna package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.5+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1').
libupnp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
